I write not for you to read, but for me to remember.

instruction: Imagine a brief letter revealing a goodbye written under starlight.
response:
Dear past self,
I never thought I’d write these words. The story of a goodbye written under starlight still lingers in my thoughts. Each day I wonder if anyone will understand why I did what I did.
Some stories are better kept in silence.

instruction: Imagine a journal entry concerning a survivor’s final note.
response:
To the stars above,
I never thought I’d write these words. The story of a survivor’s final note still lingers in my thoughts. Each day I wonder if anyone will understand why I did what I did.
I write not for you to read, but for me to remember.
